column4: in a crontab i want to grep a log file for things that happened today, how can i do that? The date format is like [Sat May 19 00:08:43 2012]
`grep 'Sat May 19 ' /path/to/logfile` should do it.
it should work for all days :-)
something like '%D %M %d......?
Ah, I see. In that case:
grep `date '+%a %b %d'` /path/to/logfile
Check out the date manpage for more info :)
Actually, needs quoting, so:
grep "`date '+%a %b %d'`" /path/to/logfile
i'll test it, thx!
shouldn't it be grep "`date +'%a %b %d'`" /path/to/logfile  ?
Yes, also spotted that and corrected in my last response
you said grep "`date '+%a %b %d'`" tmp_error_logs.log -> crontab says there 's an error in that line
If you're placing that command in a crontab you'll need to escape the %
i have this, still err   grep "`date '+%%a %%b %%d'`" file.log
Replace %% with \%
still error: grep "`date '+\%a \%b \%d'`"  :-s
Might be easier to put the command in a shell script
And checkout `man 5 crontab`
if i put it in a shell script -> should i escape too?
No need to escape the % characters
